titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Henry T. Bernstein on Environmental History Collection, 1965-1989 AIS.1994.12
titlestmt.author: Jamie Peretich and Christina Reed. Revisions occurred to the finding aid as a part of the encoding process in February 2006.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-06-11 09:23:13 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Henry T. Bernstein Collection on Environmental History
did.abstract: Henry T. Bernstein, a professor of environmental history in London, England, assembled this collection of materials to document the various social, governmental, and economic programs and issues surrounding the burgeoning environmental movement of the 1960s and 1970s. The collection contains brochures, reports, newspaper clippings, event announcements, postcards, notes, correspondence, and publications that describe the current state of environmental awareness and environmental issues across Europe. The materials mainly document Great Britain, but they are also involved with environmental issues in continental Europe and the United States, and are in English, German, French, Italian, and Spanish.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: As an environmental historian, Henry T. Bernstein, originally a Californian, specialized in research on forests and shipbuilding in the Indus-Ganges basin. He was one of the first academics in Great Britain to develop an interest in and teach a course on twentieth century British environmental history. As an academic discipline, environmental history draws upon the social sciences, the natural sciences, and the humanities - these varying disciplines are reflected in his collection of environmental materials.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The collection contains materials detailing environmental history in Europe and the United States, with a specific emphasis on Great Britain, from approximately 1965 to the early 1980s. It deals with several overarching themes, such as the different types of environments, the changes occurring to those environments, and the actions taken by government, voluntary organizations, individuals, and others in order to retard or reverse environmental degradation. The collection also includes reports and publications regarding environmental policy and political issues which are not widely available in the United States. Bernstein's notes, which can be found throughout the collection, may have been used for instruction in his environmental history classes at St. Mary's College in London. The documents occur in several different forms, such as brochures, reports, newspaper clippings, event announcements, postcards, notes, correspondence, and publications, and in several different languages, such as German, French, Italian, and Spanish. If undated, folders include documents covering much of the entire date range of the collection.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift of Henry T. Bernstein, October 1993.

odd.head: Previous Citation
odd.p: Henry T. Bernstein Collection on Environmental History, 1965-1989, AIS.1994.12, Archives Service Center, University of Pittsburgh

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was processed by Jamie Peretich and Christina Reed in March 2005.

Revision and rearrangement for the encoded version of the finding aid provided by Charles Stanford in February 2006. Information about the collection title and the controlled access terms was extracted from the MARC record in the University of Pittsburgh catalog Voyager ID number: 4494229

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: Permission for publication is given on behalf of the University of Pittsburgh as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission of the copyright holder, which must also be obtained.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series contains the reports, conference proceedings, publications, and articles of several European and International conferences concerning the environment in the 1970s-1980s. Also included are documents related to the United Nations and other international groups that considered environmental issues during the 1970s. Especially prominent in this series are the Council of Europe and the United Nations (particularly their conference on the environment in Stockholm in 1972).

Commission Des Communautes Europeennes (Commission of the European Communities)

unittitle.title: The Management of the Environment in Tomorrow's Europe

did.unittitle: International Conference on the Environment, Papers
United Nations and the Human Environment

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series contains information related to environmental issues in European countries, in the United States, and elsewhere in the world. These documents are in the form of publications, brochures, newspaper clippings, correspondence, reports, and essays. This material is often in languages other than English, and includes documentation from the mid-1960s through the late 1970s. Finally, the materials in this series are grouped by country in the following order: Germany, France, Italy, Scotland, miscellaneous nations, and lastly the United States.

did.unittitle: First Report on the Italian Environment
Annual Report for the Registrar of Scotland
Scottish Home and Health Department Reports
Environment by Country - USSR and Norway
Chapter V: Leman and the Rhine
Chapter IV: NYC and the World
NYC Northeast Power Failure and Urban Crisis (Chapter I-II)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series includes information specifically related to England in the 1960s and 1970s. Subjects include: transportation, various types of pollution, the preservation of the countryside or natural areas, city living, power and energy, water conservation, the preservation of historic buildings, safety, and the actions taken concerning environment. The materials are generally in the form of brochures, government publications, newspaper clippings, event announcements, Bernstein's notes, and correspondence.

did.unittitle: Tower Hamlets - Factories and Warehouses Available
Energy Alternatives, Fossil Fuel (oil, coal, gas)
Noise and Aircraft, Concorde and London
Human and Social Aspects and Environs Change

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This material deals specifically with the environmental issues in the city of London. It is dated mainly in the 1960s and 1970s. The form of the documents includes brochures, city planning reports, publications, newspaper clippings, correspondence, etc.

did.unittitle: Reconstruction in the City of London
Port of London, Thames Pollution Control

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series contains the papers of the proceedings of the Greater London Development Plan (GLDP) Inquiry. The papers concern various areas of environmental concern in London, such as housing, pollution, and transportation. Box 15, folders 1 and 2 include information about the conference and give descriptions of the labeling schema used to describe these documents. The GLDP was in session between 1970 and 1973.

did.unittitle: GLDP Inquiry, Guide to the GLDP Papers

GLDP Inquiry ZE, ZO, ZS, ZP
